isis.stitle: TSI 93-10-02 - Vehicle Identification Number and Serial Number Location on Major Components Used on International Vehicles Since January 1, 1991

subjectgroup.subject: Vehicle Identification Number and Serial Number Location on Major Components Used on International Vehicles Since January 1, 1991

lev1.title: GENERAL
lev1.para: This letter has been developed to help service personnel locate the Vehicle Identification Number, Serial Number and Build Date, along with the Model Number on major components used on International vehicles. Also included is information necessary to break down the Serial Number (where necessary) for unit identification and parts information.

lev1.title: CHASSIS SERIAL NUMBER
lev1.para: All International vehicles have the chassis serial number stamped on the left side of the frame, near the left front spring. Locations are listed and illustrated in Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Chassis Serial Number

note.para: Because of special equipment installation, serial number location may vary slightly on some individual vehicles.

lev1.title: VEHICLE IDENTIFICATION NUMBER AND BUILD DATE
lev1.para: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) and Vehicle Build Date can be found on the identification plate attached to the vehicle in the following locations:

entry.para: Left door opening, rear post ( Figure 2)
Mounted next to the Hydro-Max ( Figure 3)
On engine side of the cowl panel, next to the air cleaner ( Figure 4)

figure.caption: Figure 2. VIN Tag Location
Figure 3. VIN Tag Location on Stripped Chassis
Figure 4. VIN Tag Location on 1600 and 3000 Models

lev2.title: Bendix
lev2.para: A nameplate ( Figure 5) identifying the compressor piece number and serial number is attached to the side of the compressor crankcase.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Bendix Nameplate

lev2.title: Midland
lev2.para: A nameplate ( Figure 6) identifying the Midland compressor part number (date code) and Navistar part number is attached to the side of the compressor crankcase.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Midland Nameplate

lev2.title: Rockwell
lev2.para: An identification tag and serial number tag ( Figure 7) are on the front of the clutch cover. Use the number on the identification tag to identify the clutch and ordering parts.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Rockwell Clutch Identification and Serial Number Tags

lev2.title: Spicer
lev2.para: Spicer clutches are identified as shown in Figure 8.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Spicer Clutch Identification

lev2.title: Eaton Valeo
lev2.para: The clutch pressure plate and cover assembly, and the clutch disc have ink-stamped reference numbers ( Figure 9). The pressure plate and cover assembly, and the disc number are not the same. These reference numbers are important for clutch model identification. Locate the reference numbers on the front or rear of the driven disc face and on the rear face of the pressure plate assembly. The reference numbers can be cross-referenced through the Replacement Parts Catalog to establish the clutch model designation.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Eaton Valeo Clutch Reference Numbers

lev2.title: Caterpillar Engines
lev2.para: Caterpillar engines have the serial number and engine model number stamped on the "serial number plate" located on the right rear side of the cylinder block. The serial number is also shown on the "information plate" located on the valve cover ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Caterpillar Engine Information and Serial Number Plates

lev2.title: Cummins Engines
lev2.para: The dataplate ( Figure 12) shows information about the engine. The engine serial number (1) and Control Parts List (CPL) (2) provide information for ordering parts and service needs.
The engine dataplate must not be changed unless approved by Cummins Engine Company, Inc.
On L10 Series engines the dataplate is located on the fuel pump side of the engine on the side of the rocker housing ( Figure 11).
On N14 engines the dataplate is located on the fuel pump side of the engine on the front cover ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Cummins Engine Dataplate Location
Figure 12. Cummins Engine Dataplate

lev2.title: Detroit Diesel Series 60 Engines
lev2.para: The engine serial and model numbers are stamped on the cylinder block in the location shown in Figure 13.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Detroit Diesel Series 60 Tag Identification and Location

lev3.title: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine
lev3.para: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engines are identified by Engine Serial Number and Engine Model Code.
The permanent engine serial number ( Figure 14) is stamped on the front top side of the crankcase.
The Engine Emission Label identifies the engine model code and shipping date. The Emission Label is located on the left valve cover ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. International 7.3 Engine Tag Identification and Location

lev3.title: DT/DTA-360 Diesel Engine
lev3.para: When in need of parts, always specify the engine model and serial number ( Figure 15). The engine serial number is stamped on the crankcase pad located on the left side of the engine below center of intake manifold ( Figure 16). In some instances, a glue-on label indicating the engine serial number is affixed to the throttle linkage bracket or intake manifold. An engine exhaust emission label is located on the top of the intake manifold. The engine emission label designates the model and shipping date as well as other pertinent information.

figure.caption: Figure 15. DT/DTA-360 Serial Number Explanation
Figure 16. DT/DTA-360 Tag Identification and Location

lev3.title: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine
lev3.para: When in need of parts, always specify the engine model and serial number ( Figure 17). The engine serial number is stamped on the crankcase pad located on the left side of the engine below center of intake manifold ( Figure 18). In some instances, a glue-on label indicating the engine serial number is affixed to the throttle linkage bracket. An engine exhaust emission label is located on the top of the intake manifold. The engine emission label designates the model and assembly date as well as other pertinent information.

figure.caption: Figure 17. DT/DTA-466 Engine Serial Number Explanation
Figure 18. DT/DTA-466 Engine Tag Identification and Location

lev2.title: Eaton
lev2.para: Eaton axles are identified by a metal tag welded to the forward side of the Axle I-Beam as shown in Figure 19. The tag contains the axle part number, model number, serial number and the load capacity in pounds.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Eaton Axle Tag Identification and Location

lev2.title: Rockwell
lev2.para: To correctly identify your axle model specification, there is an I.D. tag riveted on the rear of the axle beam ( Figure 20). When ordering replacement parts, be sure to specify the model number stamped on the I.D. tag.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Rockwell Axle Tag Example and Location

lev2.para: Current design non-driving front axle model numbers begin with two letters followed by the model numbers. Each digit designates the information shown in Figure 21.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Rockwell Axle Tag Identification

lev2.title: Spicer
lev2.para: The Spicer front non-driving steer axles are identified with a tag located between the spring pads, on the front side of the center beam section ( Figure 22). The tag contains the serial number, the model number, and the assembly number.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Spicer Axle Tag Identification and Location

lev2.para: The Spicer model numbering system provides pertinent information about the axle for easy identification ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Spicer Axle Model Identification

lev2.title: Eaton
lev2.para: Differential carrier identification is either stamped on the carrier itself or on a metal tag affixed to the carrier ( Figure 24). Location on the carrier is the same.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Eaton Differential Carrier Identification

lev2.para: The complete axle is identified by the specifications number stamped on the rear right-hand side of the axle housing ( Figure 25). This number identifies all component parts of the axle as built by Eaton, including special OEM requirements such as yoke or flange. In addition, some axles may include a metal identification tag.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Eaton Complete Axle Specification Number

lev2.para: Ring Gear and Drive Pinion are matched parts and must be replaced in sets. Check the appropriate parts book for part numbers and ordering instructions. To aid in identifying gear sets, both parts are stamped with such information as number of pinion and ring gear teeth, individual part number and matched set number as illustrated in Figure 26.

lev2.title: FABCO
lev2.para: The identification tag located on the left rear of the axle housing contains the axle assembly number, the serial number and the build date ( Figure 27). It is recommended when referring to components of the axle assembly that all the information recorded on this tag be obtained to aid in correct identification.

figure.caption: Figure 26. FABCO Axle Identification Tag and Location

lev2.title: Rockwell
lev2.para: Rockwell Axle Tag Identification and Location are shown in Figure 28.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Rockwell Axle Tag Identification and Location

lev2.title: Spicer
lev2.para: The identification tag located on the left rear of the axle housing contains the axle assembly number, the serial number and the build date ( Figure 29). It is recommended when referring to components of the axle assembly that all the information recorded on this tag be obtained to aid in the correct identification. Refer to the Spicer rear differential identification for information relating to differential assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Spicer Driving Axle Tag Identification and Location, and Gear Set Identification

lev2.title: Robert Bosch
lev2.para: Robert Bosch fuel injection pump identification is shown in Figure 30.

figure.caption: Figure 29. Robert Bosch Injection Pump Identification

entry.para: 320 = Number code for location of feed pump and governor
R = Rotation of pump as seen from drive end (right hand clockwise)
R = Located on right end of pump

lev2.title: Stanadyne
lev2.para: Fuel injection pump name plate is located on left hand side of pump housing as viewed when mounted on engine ( Figure 31). The name plate shows pump models in code form and indicates pump characteristics. Example of code is as follows:
DB2 - D series pump, B rotor, 2 second generation.
8 - Number of cylinders
31 - Abbreviation of plunger diameter (.310 inch [7.87 mm])
4631 - Specification Number, determines selection of parts and adjustments
J - Plant Code

figure.caption: Figure 30. Stanadyne Fuel Injection Pump Tag Location

lev2.title: Sheppard
lev2.para: A number is cast into the steering gear housing and identifies the basic family the gear belongs to.

Stamped letters and numbers on an exposed machined surface of the housing opposite the mounting side identifies the gear specification; see gear P/N chart in Figure 32. In the example the complete identification is Model M-100ADIAL. Cast number M-100 would refer to the M-Series steering gear family.

figure.caption: Figure 31. Sheppard Power Steering Gear Part Number Chart

lev2.title: TRW
lev2.para: The steering gear specification number and date code are stamped on a machined surface opposite the input shaft of every TAS gear ( Figure 33). An example code would be 012-90; this means the gear was built on the 12th day of 1990.

figure.caption: Figure 32. TRW Power Steering Gear Specification Number Location

lev2.title: Vickers
lev2.para: Vickers pump identification is shown in Figure 34, Figure 35, and Figure 36.

figure.caption: Figure 33. Vickers Power Steering Pump Identification
Figure 34. Vickers Power Steering Pump Identification (Cont.)
Figure 35. Vickers Power Steering Pump Identification (Cont.)

lev1.title: RADIATOR
lev1.para: Radiators will be identified by serial number and part number and/or build date on a tag located on top, on the side, or on a tag fastened to the radiator core ( Figure 37).

figure.caption: Figure 36. Radiator Tag Location

lev1.title: CHARGE AIR COOLER
lev1.para: Charge air coolers will be identified either on top with an identification tag, or the part number and build date will be engraved into the side intake ( Figure 38).

figure.caption: Figure 37. Charge Air Cooler Tag Location

lev2.title: International
lev2.para: All axle assemblies are identified with two tags. One located on the differential carrier, and the other on the right front leg of the banjo housing ( Figure 39). The carrier tag contains the serial number, the carrier assembly number, and the ratio. The housing tag contains the serial number, model number, and the axle assembly number.

figure.caption: Figure 38. International Rear Axle Tag Identification and Location

lev2.para: Manufacture date-date gear set was made.
401GR128-part number of ring gear (typical).
Tooth Combination (i.e., 39-11)-indicates the pinion has 11 teeth and the ring gear 39 teeth which result in a 3.54:1 ratio.

Matched set number-ring and pinions are manufactured as a matched set. Both pieces are marked with a corresponding number (i.e., 268) which identifies them as a matched set. The gear set that does not have the same matching numbers should not be run together. If either a ring gear or pinion require replacement, they must be replaced as a matched set.

figure.caption: Figure 39. International Gear Set Identification

lev2.title: Rockwell
lev2.para: Refer to Figure 41 for Rockwell rear axle tag identification and Figure 42 for the tag location.

figure.caption: Figure 40. Rockwell Rear Axle Tag Identification
Figure 41. Rockwell Rear Axle Tag Location

lev2.title: Spicer
lev2.para: All axle assemblies are identified with two tags. One located on the differential carrier, and the other on the right front leg of the banjo housing ( Figure 43). The carrier tag contains the serial number, the carrier assembly number, and the ratio. The housing tag contains the serial number, model number, and the axle assembly number.

figure.caption: Figure 42. Spicer Rear Axle Tag Identification and Location

lev2.para: Gear Set Identification ( Figure 44)
Manufacture date-date gear set was made.
401GR128-part number of ring gear (typical).
Tooth Combination (i.e., 39-11)-indicates the pinion has 11 teeth and the ring gear 39 teeth which result in a 3.54:1 ratio.

Matched set number-ring and pinions are manufactured as a matched set. Both pieces are marked with a corresponding number (i.e., 268) which identifies them as a matched set. The gear set that does not have the same matching numbers should not be run together. If either a ring gear or pinion require replacement, they must be replaced as a matched set.

note.para: Pinion gears manufactured after April 1, 1986 will have the part number, the steel heat code and manufacture date located on the pinion shaft between the bearings.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Spicer Gear Set Identification

lev2.title: Allison
lev2.para: The part number (P/N or A/N) and serial number are shown on the identification tag as illustrated in Figure 45.

figure.caption: Figure 44. Allison Transmission Tag Location

lev2.title: Clark
lev2.para: Clark tag location is shown in Figure 46.

figure.caption: Figure 45. Clark Transmission Tag Location

lev2.title: Eaton/Fuller
lev2.para: All Eaton Fuller Transmissions are identified by model and serial number ( Figure 47). This information is stamped on the transmission identification tag and affixed to the case ( Figure 48). DO NOT REMOVE OR DESTROY THE TRANSMISSION IDENTIFICATION TAG.

figure.caption: Figure 46. Eaton/Fuller Transmission Tag Identification

calloutgroup.callout1: F = Used in letter designation, denotes forward position of gear shift lever (RTOF-11609A).
X = Used in letter designation, replaces "O" in overdrive models to denote that a direct shift pattern is available. RTO-11609 would be RTX-11609.
L = Following numbers; used for construction models to denote a low gear in addition to designated speeds (RTO-11607L). "LL" = two low speeds.

figure.caption: Figure 47. Eaton/Fuller Transmission Tag Location

lev2.title: Rockwell
lev2.para: An identification plate is installed on the side of the transmission ( Figure 50). Use the information on the identification plate when ordering parts. An explanation of the model identification number and the identification plate is as shown in Figure 49.

figure.caption: Figure 48. Rockwell Transmission Tag Identification

lev2.para: New Process utilizes a number for transmissions that provide data about each model. The metal tag indicates OEM identification, date of manufacture, shift identification, engineering identification (if required) and the New Process Model Number ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Rockwell Transmission Tag Location and New Process Tag Identification

calloutgroup.callout1: A = Location of identification tag is under the two cover screws, for either left or right hand PTO locations.

lev2.title: Spicer
lev2.para: Spicer uses a numbering system for its SST-2 and synchronized transmissions that provides a great deal of information about a particular model. A model number gives a general indication of torque capacity, number of speeds, case material, whether top gear is direct or overdrive, and ratio designation. A single letter suffix indicates a straight, mechanically shifted transmission, while a number/letter denotes an air shifted unit. The example in Figure 51 applies to the Spicer SST-2 models.

For the 40, 55, and 60 series of synchronized transmissions, the same numbering system is used to indicate the same information, except the first two digits refer to approximate torque capacity in hundreds of lbs. ft., not thousands. The example in Figure 51 applies to the Spicer synchronized models.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Spicer Transmission Model Numbering System

lev2.para: For transmission tag location, refer to Figure 52.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Spicer Transmission Tag Location

lev2.title: International
lev2.para: For turbocharger identification plate information and location, refer to Figure 53.

figure.caption: Figure 52. International Turbocharger Identification Plate Information and Location
